content.description: Sit start with a big, left hand pinch and a right hand, sidepull edge. From there, slap the right hand up, walk the feet, move to a left hand sidepull, bump up to the big, flat shelf, bump to the right hand pinch, bump the left hand to the arete's sidepull, reach a right hand edge below the lip, continue from there to the lip, and top out just left of the large rock on top the boulder.
content.protection: At least two pads. The landing is pretty good, but there are several rock surrounding the problem and a few benign ones in the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the northeast face of Sandbox.

content.description:
Aim For the Flat Top ascends a solid slab through the use of balanced movement.

Stand start with a pair of edges about five feet off the deck. From there, gain a high right foot, and reach a diagonal right hand edge, follow with the feet to the good edge, reach the lip, and mantle atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads would be ideal. The immediate landing is clear and flat, but the landing drops off behind.
content.location: It climbs the east facing slab on the Sandbox Stone.
